review: Our server was really nice and was very fast with his service. We sat near the bar area in the 2 seated tall tables and our food was really good as well. I wish there was more fish for the fish and chips though! I love it that much! The only reason I didn't give all 5 stars was it was just a bit too crowded for my comfort. But if you're all into it then it's perfect for you!

Truly awful service. The restaurant was nearly empty and I still got barely any attention from wait staff. The waiter ignored me for a while. When my food came out, I still hadn't gotten my drink so I asked for it. The food was okay - nothing special. The salad was drenched in dressing - way too much!  When I was finished, the waiter took my plate and didn't bring my bill. I asked for it next time I saw him and he gave me the wrong check. This whole time he was organizing cutlery and stacking cups. They should really be doing this in the back of the restaurant, and servers shouldn't be doing this when there are customers. Not somewhere I'll go again at the airport.

I wasn't expecting fine dining at this airport location, but the food came out somewhat cold. My daughter had boneless wings and fries and I had the French dip. The fries were lukewarm and the wings were down right cold. My daughter didn't seem to mind, as she is not picky. No time to send things back when you have to make your flight, so we ate it and ran to make our connection. In the plus side, we had a nice view of the runway which my daughter enjoyed !

The hostess mad me wait even though there were empty tables. I hate that. My family was in the restaurant business and we would have fired employees for not quickly seating customers. Empty tables means no revenue. Once seated, the lazy waitress decided to talk to me and the table next to me at the same time. She wanted to save time and explain the menu and take drink orders only once. They were slow to seat everyone, now they are in a hurry to take orders? The couple at the table next to me and I just shook our heads once the waitress left. I ordered the chicken fingers and fries. It was just fried food, nothing special. The customer service was the primary issue during this visit.

This restaurant is in dire need of John Taffer! Smells like a dirty college bar.   Arrived at 830 pm they tell us about 20 minutes, no biggie.  After an hour and the restaurant is almost empty a server comes out to tell us they forgot to mention they are closing early. Most tgif's are great, this one no so much.

HORRIBLE!  I know this is an airport (Concourse E) but come on I need some edible food. I received one of the worst breakfasts of my life. My "orange juice" was yellow, not orange. I think it was instant and made from a powder. It didn't even taste like Tang or Sunny D. My food arrived on a chipped plate. The fruit was one wilted strawberry. The inside of my omelette was cold and had old looking broccoli. Do yourself a favor, save some money and go to McDonalds across the walkway.

First off, how cool is it to have TGIF's inside an airport? Really cool! I had a 3 hour delay for my next flight to Tampa, FL and I was starving! Luckily, I walked passed by TGIF's and I was like yes please! I was immediately sat down and I ordered a platter that had buffalo wings, baked potatoes, celery, and fries. It may not sound much, but it is extremely filling! Delicious every bite and every dip! The staff was amazing! Very fun, humorous, and friendly to talk to! I would love to grab a bite next time when I go to my hometown again! Overall, thank you for the service! Love it here!
Great restaurant! Great Jack Daniel burger and Tennessee  whisky cake!!!! Great  service!!!!

Although it's been a while since I've eaten  at TGI Friday's, I was pleasantly surprised at the level of service and the attentiveness of the staff especially at an airport! After running from the train to TSA then the airline counter and unfortunately missing my flight, I was in desperate need of food. The hostess asked if I wanted a high top table but since I was traveling solo, I opted for a seat at the bar. Rocky, the bartender, immediately greeted me and took my drink order. I ordered a Kona beer and the spicy Black Bean & Avocado Burger for my entree. Food didn't take long to come; maybe 15 minutes. The sandwich was actually pretty good. It was the right level of spice. The fries were average; nothing that a little ketchup or honey mustard couldn't fix. The only issue was the amount of times Rocky used "sweetheart" and "love" when greeting her guests. It can be a bit annoying when used excessively or when she'd acknowledge a guest 2 or 3x her age!

Was surprised at how quickly I got a table considering the line.  Very well managed!  Had a 4 hour layover and had time to have a proper lunch.  They did not disappoint!  Timely, accurate service - very attentive despite the crowd.  Food was delicious - love the Sesame Jack Strips & salad.  Wine pour on point.  Server was delightful.  Don't hesitate to choose here if in this airport!
Poor service, long wait time for service and no attention to detail. Don't expect too much here. Grab a bite and go

Kind of on the pricey side for what you get. Strong stench coming from the kitchen. Would've been better off just ordering from Mickey d's and getting my beer elsewhere. The seats and tables were super sticky and the restaurant was super crowded. Actually saw some people jet once they got it because the place stunk. Gave a 10% tip because I could tell the waitresses were somewhat trying but due to the ambiance and price for quality I won't be back.

Not bad food and beer selection.  The staff was not the most efficient and the bartender was rude. It's a decent spot to take a load off during a layover or hanging out with family before taking off. This restaurant is located next to the security line and it's the cheaper option of dining between the two major sit down restaurants near the security line.

Decent food with great service. Loved my server, Sheila, and her partner in crime, Evelyn. Food came out quickly and was hot and tasty. Big kudos for keeping my iPad safe for me when I walked away and left it. Total ding-dong moment!!!!!!  Would definitely visit them again.

Wanted to grab a quick snack and I regret stopping here. The restaurant smelt and there was a crazy amount of flies near the bar. I lost my appetite before I got my food and wanted to leave. I ordered the quesadillas which appeared old and dry. Next time I'm in terminal E i think I would rather go to McDonalds.
Stuck at the airport for dinner.  The burger was ok and the side spinach was very basic.  While the food was average the service was friendly but very slow.

this is such an awesome lo atiom. Tbe team on today, 9 May, afternoon shift is top notch...A plus crew. zdrinks, food, and staff exceptional!! Alwzys  stop here wben time permits...but TODAY  .. Im over the moon!

We had a great lunch at this TGI Fridays! Airport food can be so-so and while we just ordered an appetizer platter and iced tea, the food tasted fantastic. Airports can be stressful, but the service was very friendly and attentive!!!  The menu was the same as other Fridays locations and offered plenty of appetizers, salads, soups, burgers, steaks, chicken dishes and desserts. In addition to all the great food, they had a full bar! The location is great for those waiting for a flight or waiting for those to come in from a flight! I'd visit, again!

Breakfast was the worst omelet I've probably ever had, but I guess I deserved that for ordering an omelet from Fridays.  We stopped in again on our trip back in the evening and the potato skins were a second disappointment.  Only half way covered with cheese.  See photo.

The last time I went to a Friday's was 7 years ago. The reason why I never returned is because the service was so terrible that I did not want to give it another shot. Years later, I come across one at the airport and decide to play nice. First, they take 5 minutes to plan where they were going to sit us when the restaurant was practically empty. We finally get a seated. I ordered a Henny strawberry and my boyfriend gets an ice tea. We were getting ready to order wings and they told us that they only had bone-less wings-- not my favorite. I said ok can we please have 2 more minutes. The waitress came back 15 MINUTES later. I did not even want to order anymore at this point considering the fact that we'd been traveling all day. Anyway, we nicely told our waitress that we were no longer interested. We get hit with a $15 bill for an ice tea and one alcoholic drink at TGI???? LOL. I am just over this place and will no longer give it a shot. The service sucks and customers should definitely get a heads up about what's on the menu and what is NOT on the menu at the moment.

The service here was very professional.  My frozen appetizers had been excellently reheated.  The boneless wings were not awful but the potato skins were a little sad and blank.  And greasy. The oreo ice cream sandwich was off the charts, however.  It's an airport restaurant, so I wasn't expecting Per Se but I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service.

Stopped by for dinner on a 3-hour layover. Service: Both the hostess and waitress were very kind. I was seated immediately and asked for a drink order. Additionally, throughout my meal, the waitress came to check up on me frequently which was nice. Atmosphere: It was dark, the floor was sticky, and it smelled like dirty mop water everywhere. Food: I had a peach sangria, potstickers, and the pecan-crusted chicken salad. The sangria was good but very expensive ($12, but it's the airport so I'm not surprised). The potstickers themselves were tasty, but they gave me hardly any of the sauce at all (probably 1/2 a teaspoon's worth). Also the sauce was advertised as a "Szechwan dipping sauce". It's just soy sauce, don't kid yourself. The salad was probably the most disappointing of all. I asked for no cranberries or bleu cheese. Guess what it came with? Yep, you guessed it. Also, the chicken felt like it was destroyed in the microwave. I cut neither cut into it with my (plastic) knife, nor bite into it with my teeth. Anyways, I left the waitress a good tip for the service but there's nothing else I'd come back for.

LAKEA provided the worst customer service ever! Came in first thing in the am after a long delay for my flight and even though it was the start of her day she seemed miserable. After being seated which was immediate the restaurant had just opened and only 3tables filled including us. She seemed to give the manager some backchat regarding her placement of our seat. She had on a jacket and no name tag so I had to find out from another waitress whom actually had on a name tag and seemed ready and happy to be at work. In any event...no refill on our drinks, never came by to check and see if the food we received was to our liking, no smile no welcome she seemed tired and it's the beginning of her shift. Our food was delicious no complaints there and other waitresses seemed more than happy to be at work and glad to help where she fell short. My rating is strictly because of her customer service or lack therof the otherwise I would give 3stars
Never leave reviews but waited about 20 minutes and never was served. Wasn't due to no staff, they were all happy to be standing around socializing.
Bad cleanser smell at the bar, but still infested with fruit flies. No chicken wings available, just the weird formed meat boneless variety. Staff is nice enough.

I have been to several airport TGI Friday's  and they haven't been bad at all. This one in particular was mediocre at best...but what can I say, we were hungry.  We received a warm welcome from the hostess and our waitress was also very friendly but the food was lacking. The restaurant itself had a funny smell and the floor was a bit dirty/messy.  So yea, back to the food. I ordered the pecan crusted chicken salad and my husband ordered the Jack Daniels chicken and shrimp with sweet potato fries. These are our usual go-to dishes but they were not that great here. The pecan crusted chicken tasted like it was fried (and at one point might have been crispy) and then nuked. Same goes for the Jack Daniels entree. The Jack Daniels shrimp were not crispy at all. The sweet potato fries were kind of limp and soggy and possibly undercooked.       Another thing is that if you really have to go to the bathroom you better make a run for it across the food court because there are no restrooms here. Really the highlight of our visit was the kindness of Cory, our waiter. He even asked if we wanted dessert (a big plus in a very busy establishment).  I doubt I'll return here for food but I'm thinking for drinks it wouldn't be too bad.

We stopped here to have lunch while waiting for our connecting flight...... the portion size is so small!!! The pictures on the menu make the food look amazing. My friend got the turkey burger that was undercooked. They were out of pretzels, chicken quesadillas, eggs and toast .... how can you be out of toast???! My "chicken " in the pecan crusted chicken salad tasted like turkey. NO ALCHOL SERVED UNTIL 12pm?! The only good thing is that she forgot to charge us for the soup so we got free soup. . Do yourself a favor and just go to the fast food court next door

Staff was friendly.  They brought drinks after our food arrived.  Ordered the boneless chicken wings (Garlic Parmesan), they were soaking in grease and tasted like they were cooked yesterday. I'd pass on this restaurant, there are plenty to choose from on the terminal.

This is by far the worst TGI Fridays I have ever been too.  To start the bar tenders are very rude.  I ordered a ribeye medium and it took forever to come out only to be well done.  I asked if the bar tender thought it was medium and she would not answer me and was very rude.  Then they actually refused to even acknowledge me.  I was then told "did you want to try to complain to our manager, wink". I can not believe this.  The staff on Sunday Aug 28, 2016 needs to go through training on how to treat a customer.  Never will I eat at a Friday's again because of this location.  I would usually go to Friday's 3 times a week.  Now I never will go again due to the unprofessionalism of the  bar tender that treated me like dirt under her finger nail.

I don't write a lot of reviews and TGI Friday's is pretty much the same wherever you go, by my experience in the restaurant was Amazing, from the receptionist to the bartenders to the managers checking in how I and my food were doing.  We had an obnoxious drunk at the bar and the team handled it with class.  I felt so welcome here I will be back during my trips to ATL!

Its a fine place to kill time until your flight. The steak is good, but their Jack Daniels sauce is what makes everything worth it. Their fries are well seasoned, but their potatoes and vegetables are comparably bland. If you care about sweet tea being sweet, this place has you covered, for their tea is just the right amount of sweet without becoming an unbearable syrupy slosh. If you are flying in a large group of people tough, don't have high expectations, this isn't the place for you.

Ordered a salad and asked for it to be "gluten free" as marked on their menu.  Not only were breaded onions buried underneath the letuce, the dressing wasn't Gluten free either.  The manager did not have a clue to gluten sensitivity even though it's on her menu.  Probably the last tgif that i'll go to.

I stopped here and had a quick lunch while I was on a lay over in the Atlanta airport. I ordered  the Jack Daniels burger with fries and a glass of ice tea. The waitress took my order very quickly and made sure my tea was kept filled. My burger and fries was out and no time. It was hot and fresh and very tasty. I actually would have given them a 5 star rating as my food and service was very good. However the service staff was talking very loud about very private and inappropriate things for the whole restaurant to hear. It made the dining experience a bit akward.

I eat at TGI-Friday's almost every time I go through Atlanta Airport.  The restaurant is convenient, the prices aren't bad for notoriously overpriced airport fare, the breakfast is above average and in reasonable quantities.  I had a bloody Mary on this visit and it was superb, even though they were out of BM mix.  They ad libbed and it turned out great!
I had a very good steak salad.  Howard was my waiter and did an amazing job.  I rarely get to the E terminal, but when I do I'm going to see Howard at TGIF.

TGI Fridays doesn't really equal amazing food in my mind. With that kept in my back pocket, I really had a fine experience.  It's located in Terminal E at the airport, and it does get busy. Probably because you can sit down and eat for the same price you can buy food in the food court right next to it.  We sat down, ordered right away, and we're out in 40 minutes. But we did tell our server that we needed to be rushed ahead of time. She was very helpful, I'm sure she's used to that.  The service was great, ours was so friendly and nice. Everyone around you is hustling and bustling but it's an airport.  The only complaint I had was in my food. I ordered the chicken salad sandwich, and it was supposed to be served on multigrain bread. It came on a hamburger bun. Not the end of the world, just much unhealthier for me. But what the heck, I was still on vacation. It did taste delicious and my fries were great. My husband ate every last one I didn't finish. He ordered the chicken and spinach skillet and said it was great, ate every bite.  Our total was only $24, and for an airport meal that seems pretty decent to me. Especially when the food court meals are the same price.
Had 5 star service yesterday. (1/11) from Charice (or Candace) her and her crew sat me bright and early and gave the best service and food recos. Great staff and it was a nice welcome to ATL.

Stopped for lunch here and there was a 30 minute wait after we were seated to order water, then another 15 for the water to come out and another 20 to order. The food came out and the California club looked nothing like it did on the menu, it was a cold sand which and pretty mediocre. The service was slow and not amicable.

One should only expect so much from a restaurant in an airport, and this one is no exception.  I ordered a steak, blue rare, and wasn't overly surprised that it came out overcooked. What did surprise me was that it was way overcooked, more medium-well versus medium-rare. However, my server was quick to rectify the situation and did so pleasantly. Overall, dinner wasn't too bad. I ended up going back in later (6+ hour layover) to watch the Thursday night football game. I ordered some mozzarella sticks for something to chew on. Bad choice. The coating wasn't very tasty nor crispy and the cheese inside was just so-so. Again, only expect so much from an airport restaurant.

I had an hour before boarding but definitely wanted to sit and have a beer with lunch- this was a good place for that. My waitress was very chatty but didn't crowd my space. I ordered the Jack Daniels Sampler. Honestly, the ribs and shrimp were fine, but the chicken was over breaded and over cooked and I didnt even eat it. The sauce was the star of the plate, but there was barely any sauce, I think I dipped 3 shrimp and 1 rib and the sauce was gone.

Stopped in here for a beer and a light lunch during a long layover in Atlanta.  Both the bartenders were friendly (I sat at the bar), and I didn't have to wait long for a beer or to put my order in, but the bar wasn't busy at all either though. One of the things I enjoy at some airport bars is when they have plugs to charge devices at the bar or when they have good room for your carry on bags to keep safe by you or hang.  Unfortunately they don't have any of these here.  It was also not very spacious, so I can see that if the restaurant was packed, that it could be a bit tight to fit your bags and other people's bags in safely while still having a comfortable amount of room to eat and drink in.   It's in a convenient place right at the entrance to the international terminal, and it's at least a better alternative to all the fast food restaurants in the food court across the hallway from it.

Not a bad place to have breakfast. For 8.95 you get eggs bacon or sausage, toast and potatoes. The server seemed to be a one man show, he was was very diligent and ensured we got our food quickly.  Nothing extra special about this location I was impressed with the price of breakfast. If in the international side of the ATL airport I will definitely be hitting them up for breakfast
Slow service and average food. In Addition waitress looked upset we were there and as we were a burden.
Surprisingly not busy, waited to be seated and requested a booth (4 were opened). They told me booths are for larger parties, I understand, but they weren't busy - just lazy excuses.
Just stopped for breakfast at TGI Fridays at Atlanta airport. Eric, our waiter was EXCELLENT. The food was good and the bloody Mary's were excellent. Great way to start the day

location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: Unfriendly hostess. Just kept staring without a hello or i will be with you shortly or even the obligatorily fake smile. She gave corporate types the better seats and sent the casually dressed to the back dark areas. The waitress was friendly so I decided against a tip penalty. This was the tgi in terminal T. As for the meal it was decent.

First time at a Tgifridays and it will be my last. I understand it's an airport but that is not am excuse for cold food that is prepared wrong. If you are going to serve a breakfast selection please make sure it's better then they teach elementary kids in a home economic class!  Maybe add some wait staff that speaks pleasantly and not just when they are bringing you your check and looking for a tip.
Bartenders were nice, but the place just smelled like old moldy clothes and there were fruit flies flying around. Yuck.
The hostess was rude and argumentative. She flat out ignored me twice when I tried to speak to her and seated people in line behind me first with no explanation.

I have to say this was pretty bad. we sat at the bar, the beer drip tray reeked of mildew. I didn't want to order but knowing it would be the last time I ate before I got on the plane.. had too. Food was okay besides it wasn't what we ordered (both ordered were wrong) our bartender/waiter was rude but other one came and was a lot more pleasant.

My husband &I were on the last leg of a long trip. We didn't feel like airport fast food, but didn't want to spend a fortune on a sit down meal with airport prices. We figured a TGI Fridays would be a happy medium. Were we ever WRONG! Rancid rags had been used to clean the tables which smelled. As a matter of fact, the whole place smelled of rancid rags. But we were tired & hungry so we stayed to eat... The service was downright bad. Our server was rude, never made eye contact, dropped our drinks, food & tickets at our table w/o looking at us at all as she walked by. Our ticket was actually tossed at our table. When we received our me we flagged our waitress down to ask for a real steak knife. She actually came towards our table, but not to it and spoke to us with a mouth full of food. Our steaks had a slab of frozen flavored butter on top, not melted at all... not even warm or soft; frozen solid. Obviously, the steak was cool barely warm. The broccoli was downright cold and the mashed potatoes were lukewarm. When we arrived at the restaurant we had an hour & 15 min to eat. It took so long to get our food that we did not have the time to finish our overpriced, cold poorly served meal. We will absolutely not be eating there ever again! I don't even think I'll ever go to another T. G. I. Friday's again anywhere!

Hubby and visited this location for breakfast very early on a Saturday morning about 6:45am. Breakfast menu was not very large but you can find something. Our server, Tamara, could not have been more nice, friendly or cheerful even at the early hour. Our food was pretty good, prices average for the airport, and food came out pretty quickly. We had plenty of time so we didn't feel rushed. When we did leave, about 7:15, the place had filled up very quickly with other passengers. I would definitely stop in here again for an early morning breakfast before a flight.

I guess I am very disappointed you should see the picture of the onion rings on the picture on the menu . On the menu they look correct what came on the BBQ chicken salad was pathetic . Service was great fried string beans were good.they really cut down on their portions .

Ordered a steak with brocolli and spinach.  Surprisingly (because most to the time it comes cooked too much for me), my steak came out as I ordered - rare. Overall, the steak hit the spot.  I didn't like that I had to cut my steak with a plastic fork.  Kind of odd to me.  The side dished were also good. My service was prompt and friendly. For a quick bite before your flight, this place will do.

I had a 5 hour layover so I figured I had time to have a sit down meal at the airport. Most Friday's around my area have closed so I was happy that I got to eat at a Friday's again. Their food with Jack Daniel sauce rocks!  I ordered the grilled chicken salad. Their portions are huge. You can definitely share it.  We also ordered the Sesame Jack Chicken Strips. It was more like popcorn chicken. A little too much sauce to be eaten alone so I threw some in my salad. Super tasty.  Food came out fast to accommodate all the traveler's trying to catch their flight. I was expecting customer service to be lacking since this is at an airport but it wasn't at all. Décor and staff was just like at any other Friday's restaurant. Only difference is that diners had luggage next to them.

If it were possible to give zero stars I would. Worst service and horrible food. The food took way too long and the quality was terrible. The server barely was visible to us. It took 20 minutes for the server to announce that they did not have the kind of beer my husband asked for. Ridiculous!

Never, ever, ever will I come back to the TGI Friday's in terminal E. It took THIRTY TWO MINUTES for them to give my boyfriend and I our drinks. With no apology. Absolutely terrible. I wish I could give this place zero stars.

Fast service, friendly service; however, food was crap. Ordered a burger was burnt to a crisp. Spouse order chicken tenders, they were super dried out and gross.  Ordered ultimate Long Island which was the best part. It was delicious.

I think the fact that a business is located in an airport should be an important thing to take into consideration when reviewing; if I had had this exact experience OUTSIDE of the airport, I would have gone with three stars.  The truth is that I'm not a Fridays kind of guy; the food isn't terrible or anything, it's just okay, but if I'm going spend money on a meal I want better than okay; however, when I had several hours to waste and knew that I needed edible food and a drink, Fridays seemed perfect. What I've come to expect from an airport restaurant is pretty decent food, pretty expensive prices for both food and drink, long waits for food and drinks, and slow service; in THIS particular environment, Fridays has done better by me than pretty much any other airport restaurant.  Now I'm not really familiar with Fridays, so I can't really say anything about how the food here stacks up, but I'm pretty sure the menu was reduced; some pages in their menu only had a few items.  I ended up ordering a ribeye (which was actually cooked the way asked) with cheddar mashed potatoes and spinach, and I have to say that I enjoyed my meal.  Again, it wasn't anything spectacular, but it was better than I had expected, and a whole lot better than airport food can be.  The only other thing to note is that you're given a plastic fork to cut your steak, which obviously isn't ideal, but is something you simply have to accept--it's in an airport (although even at Ohare they'll give you a damn butter knife, which is better than a plastic one, but what can you do?). The whiskey and apple drink I had was also really good, but exactly what I remember from Fridays cocktails back when I used to drink at a nearby Fridays--they're very, very sugary.  I ordered a second one but couldn't finish it because it was too sugary, not because I was drunk, so maybe next time I'll order one cocktail and then switch to something else if I wan't another drink.  I also have to mention my server Nemari, who was awesome--she's a doll--she was friendly, professional, and attentive; I have never been checked up on as frequently, and with such great timing, in an airport--she almost made me forget I was in one!  By the time I was all done and settled up , a little more than an hour had passed since I had gone in, which to me was incredible; I took my time before ordering and ate rather lazily.  If I had been in a hurry I could easily have shaved twenty minutes off of that. My bill, for the steak and two 'signature' drinks, was a little more than forty bucks plus tip, which isn't much more than I spent at another airport restaurant for a glass of wine and two appetizers.  The service was great, and food came out quickly; what more could I ask from a restaurant in general, let alone one in an airport?
The western omelet looked tasty. The only problem was I order a ham and bacon omelet with sausage on the side. Considering this is an airport restaurant, the service is very slow.

I shouldn't have expected so much from this Friday's in an airport, but we had walked so far that we didn't feel like turning back to go to Sam Adam's.  My boyfriend and I had a pre-flight snack here. I had a Gold Medal smoothie which was actually pretty good (but probably way too expensive) since it had some coconut cream in it to make it creamy. We also shared a spinach dip and a basket of fries. The basket of fries was pitiful - it looked like it was leftover. The chips were ok. We probably could have asked for more chips.  Service here is ok. The waitresses look tired, as if they need a break, but it can be a little difficult to flag them down. Prices for items here are without a doubt overpriced for what you're getting.  Should've chosen Sam Adam's instead. Or Bojangles. Something else.

It Friday everyday here! :)  ask for Bianca she will treat you right. Great place to chill after a long flight. Right by baggage claim, so your can wet you're whistle, while waiting for your car service or friends to pick you up.  Standard "Friday's" food, very easy in and out. This is my 10th time her.. See you next time.

Please check the tomato basil soup which I think is the origin of my food poisoning.  Ordered soup and a water and had a lot of gas within 30 minutes of getting out of the restaurant.  Wretched twice after I got home and feeling a little better this am.

Ate here during a layover and it was alright.  Nothing particularly special about it, but it satisfied the two things I went there for: 1) Eating chicken tenders (NOMZ)  2) Killing time during a 2 hour layover Prices are pretty reasonable and comparable to other places that aren't sit down restaurants.  Definitely a good place if you are looking to kill some time, but don't expect anything beyond unhealthy food!

Don't go here if you want service or are in a hurry. I was seated quickly then watched the manager berate his two bar tenders over some issue. Food runners don't even glance at your table. After 15 minutes with no one coming to the table (manager was at bar just standing) I just got up and left. Poor service supported by poor management.
The friendliest people and perfect drinks in the international E Concourse. Great pit stop for your next layover before a long flight! Way better service than you'd expect from a chain restaurant! :)

Ok..traveling on this day, duh...airport: Environment: Walked through the first time and kept going down the terminal, looking for something else... Strange layout in the Atlanta airport. It was crowded, not any real direction where to sit, but ended up in a row behind the bar stool row. Just ok, not a real table. Give it 1 star Service: below my minimum standard...waiting...waiting... No drink, got food then drink. Rate is 2 stars Food: I ordered the sizzling chicken and cheese with mashed potatoes. The sizzling chicken was good, but served with 2 big scoops of mashed potatoes...I don't eat that much at anytime, 1 would have been good.  I rate the food as 3 stars Over-all.... Crowded, service was ok and the food was ok as well, price was high for what I got, even in an airport.

The waitress was sweet, but after ordering a huge stack burger I was served a tiny pathetic looking kids burger. The manager swore that was what I ordered, but she wouldn't just admit they messed up. She wouldn't just apologize and explain they were missing things. What a waste of time and money. I get so tired of spending my hard earned money to be treated like I don't have the right to great service and good food. The manager avoided all my questions and wouldn't even serve me correctly. If your customer is upset what warrants you to have an attitude? This is the job you chose. Please avoid this crappy knock off of the real food chain. The food is garbage and they management is clueless. For this I would avoid this location all together. You'll end up paying triple money for awful quality food.

TGI Friday's is everywhere, and being in an airport? This one was very convenient. But it's still a TGI Friday's which means that the food is just average.  Pros: + The service was really great. The people were very kind. Real southern hospitality.  + Mozzarella Sticks are always comforting. + It's there when you're hungry.  + It's relatively speedy, which is important if you need to catch a flight.  Cons: - The food otherwise isn't very tasty. Even when it's fried, the food is pretty bland. - It's really overpriced. It's in an airport which makes it expensive already, but I expected appetizers to be around $8 - The portions were surprisingly small. I could've eaten a lot more.  At ATL, there aren't many solid places to eat, at least in the "E" concourse where we were stuck. It's not great, but it's convenient if you don't want to stop by the other food court stations.

My last reviewed place could & should take lessons from the staff here. Our food was delicious, all of the staff and our server was super welcoming and friendly and checked back with us often even though this place was packed!   Service time from the kitchen was a bit slower than we though it would be since it's at the airport, but not a hindrance to catching our flight.

First off, '89' inspection score. I worked at a Fridays back in the day and that is unacceptable.  Second, I ordered a wedge salad and wings. The wedge salad was more of a quarter and drowned in dressing. The wings were cold when served and worst of all, they don't have traditional wings here -  BONELESS ONLY. Lastly, the service was gratuitous.  Meh.
Stopped by to grab some sliders and a drink between flights. Probably the worst sliders I have ever had - dry tasteless meat and a stale bun.  The service really suffered as well.  AVOID THIS PLACE.

A-Ok sums up this TGIF.  The one thing I like about the Airport TGIF's is they know their business and clientele.  We were seated within 10 minutes (which was the estimated time they gave us when we gave our name), our waitress was at our table for drink orders almost immediately and food was brought out promptly. Additionally our waitress was incredibly friendly and funny, which is always a perk at the end of a very long business trip. My only gripe, and it's not something I'm sure they can fix, but they use the standard "Layout" for tables here, which means it's not a layout engineered for people traveling with monster bags.  If you take a table for four and you all have some serious carry-ons, then you're going to have to take a moment to work on the logistics of baggage storage.

We enjoyed our time in this airport location and in fact it was one of the better TGI Friday's I have been to ever.  The waitress was very quick getting our food and drinks.  The food taste was excellent.  I enjoyed the Jack Daniels Burger it was very good, though I asked for medium rare and received well done - it was still good.

Servers Justine, Tony and some other lady.  All over the place.  Food and beverage actually pretty good.  Prices out the wazoo.  No need to be like that, it's not like the apocalypse has happened and I am eating the last cow in the world or the last non contaminated beer.  If your loaded and don't mind patchy service and love great food this is the place for you.  To be fair Tony the last server I had was pretty good.
Atl airport location, slow service and mediocre food......
4 stars for the beer! I grabbed a few Blue Moons here while waiting for my friend and the service was great. The beer was fresh and tasty with the orange slice as well :)

I hadn't been to Friday's in a long time. It used to be a staple location to grab drinks prior to hitting the nightlife. But then I grew out of my clubbing days. Since I was in an airport figured I'd try it again. Got one off these "fancy" burgers and will say that it was perfectly cooked medium rare. Service was excellent. It was a good pit stop between flights. Great work. If I'm in this airport again with a layover I'll sure be stopping here.

You can forget the pain of a long layover here with free wifi, friendly service and huge portions.  I ordered the yucatan pulled chicken salad which can be made gluten free.  Tastes great and def enough for 2 people

Atlanta's airport is packed with all sorts of fast-food restaurants and pubs, and so it was no surprise to see that some of the nationally-known chain restaurants have opened up places to eat at the airport. I've always felt that Hartsfield-Jackson was lacking in really good restaurants, so your dining choices are more a matter of picking the lesser between a few different evils. T.G.I. Friday's is a convenient stop which offers sit-down dining and selections from their regular restaurant menu. The hostess is quite used to dealing with single travelers in a hurry, and she does a great job finding you a space to sit, store your luggage, and offer some food. The servers are fast and friendly, understanding that everyone is rushing for a connecting flight, and never making you wait for your food or for the check. In my effort to eat healthy, I skipped over the usual appetizers and Bourbon-glazed burgers, and ordered the Dragon Fire Salmon which was a marinated and grilled fillet of salmon, topped with a spicy Kung Pao sauce, mandarin orange slices, and pineapple pico de gallo, and served with steamed broccoli, and on a bed of jasmine rice. The food was served hot, and it was a very tasty lunch.... and I was in and out in about 20 minutes.
As foul as you may remember from your nightmares. Only if you are desperate, and flying American. Gross.

Ok, I know I'm in the airport and your not trying to impress me, but now you have ensured that I never will be back.  Slowest service at the worlds fastest airport.  Employees seemed pissed about having to work.  Took 10 minutes to be greeted by the server, while the restaurant was empty.  Omelette wasn't hot, it was greasy, and the potatoes were cold.  Worst coffee in the world and Deltas coffee will taste like Starbucks in comparison!  Bacon was good though!  Check please!!!!!!
Server was Shakita, service was excellent, food was predictably good, steak cooked medium as ordered. Always play it same in a chain...

One of the worst experiences at a restaurant ever. Food was horrible, cold and the greasy, which tasted old. Potato skins came with just a blob of cheese in the middle, no bacon, etc. Service was practically non existent. All the workers were standing around talking, it was difficult to get their attention. Took forever to get our food, then we had no napkins or utensils. This was the TGIF at the top of the escalator in the main terminal, not concourse E. It sure didn't show off Atlanta well to my guests.
Great place to be if you want to be ignored by staff. 10 minutes and not even a drink request at the bar. Try somewhere else if you have a flight to catch (oh, the irony!)

No other option except for the food court. I was starving after being on an early morning flight. No other choice. Whaddya gonna do? I love baked potato anything. So, I got the loaded potato skins. I swear those poor potatos were nuked in the microwave way too long. I just have one word - Chewy! And I'm not referring to that dude on Bay Area KMEL.  Salad was fine. A little too heavy on the dressing. Overall: Nothing else to say except BLAH. One star for our smiling cheerful waiter.

Agreed it is really cramped. The menu is cut short.  The service was OK considering so much was going on for the waiter.   Eat here if you want to enjoy some restaurant style food I suppose but the food court is across the way if your interested in that and again I didn't pay for my food some lady picked up our tab so I can't really complain.

Cramped small Friday's in Concourse E of Atlanta airport. There weren't many options - it was either the food court, a small bar with bar food, or Friday's so Friday's it was.  Guessing that many people were thinking the same as Friday's was packed and had to wait for a table. Finally squeezed into a tiny booth with all our carry on luggage.  Their steak salad along with a beer and appetizers was very satisfying.  Bottom line: Given the lack of choices in Concourse E, glad to have you here. And the beer hit the spot.

Terminal B: Travel partner and I decided to have a nice meal courtesy of Delta delayed flight. I had salmon and he had salad with sesame seed chicken. My salmon was ok but the rice was under cooked and the broccoli had no flavor. His chicken was not edible, horrible and soggy. The worst dining experience in a very long time. I want my $44 back!!
Good food and excellent service. Best airport restaurant that I ever tried.  Recommend you sit at the immaculate bar were Lorrie is a real darling with all customers.

Slow slow slow, for a location being about half the size of a TGI Friday's outside of the airport this place was horrible. Took about 2.5 hours for two people to dine here.  Food was really overpriced due to it being in an airport, should have just gone to the food court across the way.

World class airport, but with a mom and pop type of service. Which has a large amount of latency.  It was busy, ATL is always busy 365 days a year. I would think the staff and management would used to it by now. I was sadly mistaken. I got my drink in a timely fashion (1 point), but the food took over 20 mins to arrive. I ordered steak and half ribs (1vpoint).  .    The steak was wrong, because the lack of time to wait another 20 minutes, I touched it out. It did not tasted like the menu say it would. No TGIF, it wasn't tender. The steak was chewy and slightly room temp. .    The ribs tasted slightly warmer than room temp and looked and tasted like it came out of the microwave. .   For my sides, it was a handful of fried and as ramecan cup of slaw. Nothing special here. .    In conclusion, it was mediocre at best. If you want good, tasty, and delicious food, you won't get it here. I was hoping for too much and then I woke up.

Very disappointing egg breakfast at TGI Friday in Terminal E. Not recommended. Scrambled eggs were not hot, sausage was not hot. Toast was very dry (stale?), breakfast potatoes were hot but very small pieces. Meh.

Nothing wows me about this restaurant. But then again I don't always need to be wowed. If I can get: 1. Quick service  2. A knowledgeable and courteous staff  3. Good food  I'm good. TGIFriday's on Camp Creek provides all 3 IMO. Not real sure I how I feel about the live music on Thursdays. I got the hell outta dodge before they got ramped up. Must try dishes:  Jack Daniels burger & chicken and shrimp pasta. But be warned. The chicken and shrimp pasta is spicy!! Holy schnikes, Batman! Quite tasty tho. Also they have drink specials Monday-Thursday. Who doesn't like $3 drinks that won't kill you? Not this lush. Lol To recap: there's nothing great about this place, but there's also nothing that would stop me from going back either.

I think its pretty well understood that airport food is airport food. Standard fare but nothing spectacular. What really matters is service. Stopped in while waiting for a fellow traveler and ordered what I like to call a Coffee Supreme. Lexy greeted me with a warm smile and took my order right away. At the airport TIMELINESS is so critical. I think she knocked this one out of the box. Thank you Lexy

FUN! FUN! FUN! The staff here makes this TGI Fridays SPECIAL! By the end of my meal, I had made 8 new friends! A wonderful bunch of gals led by our server Channell. Needless to say, the service was TERRIFIC! The food was great too, especially for airport food. The staff gave me the "lift" I needed after a long flight.  We had so much fun, The girls tried out our Canon camera (40D) and took pictures on an imaginary catwalk. What a blast! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!

Our flight home was delayed a total of EIGHT hours.  If it weren't for this restaurant, the outstanding personality of the servers who were suddenly swamped, and the delicious burger I had, I might have had to kill a Delta airline staff member. The only reason I can't give this TGIF 5 stars is they got my partner's order wrong.  However, they caught it before he could even lodge a complaint and they switched out the order with sincerest apologies. As I said, the service here was amazing!
Standard TGI Fridays. Friendly staff and efficient hostesses. Our server Tim was awesome!
Food was alright but since I am traveling alone I only needed a table for one. Several groups, including a male twosome, were seated ahead of me. I won't go back.

This is a TOGO review.  As per my previous review, I had a layover here in ATL so I figured let me finish up my dinner otherwise it would be too late for my dinner time.  I pick up a pizza for my princess and I was heading back to my gate. As I was passing by, I noticed this place. It was packed so I thought it would take long for them to bring out my food. So I just stop by from the walkway and ask them how long it would take them to bring me the food? The lady said, fifteen minutes. I am happy man! Now comes the tough part, deciding on what to eat? I was handed a menu to look at and my first glance, I couldn't find anything vegetarian so I asked the lady, do you have anything vegetarian items and she suggested black bean burger with guac :) so I ordered it and paid for it. I went to drop off that pizza to my princess and came back to pick up my food. I had to wait few more mins so I decided to people watch!  This restaurant looked pretty neat and clean from the outside. I saw smiles on employes face which to me is a good sign that they are not going to mess up my order.  The lady came back and said my food is ready. I got my food, I checked and made sure  it was black bean burger. They gave me enough napkins, ketchup and they game me two wipes to clean after.  -1 for not having salt on the fries or giving couple of salt and pepper pouches.

Lots of seating, yet still cramped. I was fortunate enough to be in the back and had a a booth and surrounding tables to myself. I ordered the Jack Daniels Cheeseburger which came with 2 slices of bacon. Good sized burger that I cut in half. Came with a side order of fries. To drink I went with a french vanilla ice latte - which is a mixed drink with vanilla schnapps and vanilla vodka. Wow - this was good! The waitress asked if it was okay because she thought the bartender put a lot of liquor in when mixing. It was good - and I ordered a second.  The server, Jamika, was incredible. Good service, friendly and took care of everything I needed.
Terrible service. I've been here 10 mins and no has even acknowledged in here. Better places in Atl to eat.

Visited TGIF after almost six months. Pathetic experience. My ultimate margarita was server with a hair in it. The replacement, which was server when my dinner was almost done, was so sour that I had to order triple sec separately to add to it!! The food prep was so-so as well. The sweet potato fries had regular fried mixed in it. I was surprised the food portions have shrunk considerably.  I've been a long time TGIF fan - very disappointed with this one.  Just not worth the time or $$.
Food was mediocre, the music was loud and obnoxious and the server acted like he didn't want to be there while chewing gum badly.

This is the worst customer service I have every had waited 50 minutes for my food to be cold and no the we ordered it also the manager was very rude and the server was just completely incompetent... The people next to us also had complaints I would not recommend anyone to go there
I don't know why I keep eating at this place. The floor was greasy and they forgot about my order. When I inquired about it they found a burger and brought it to me, it was lukewarm.

Hubby and I were making a transit in Atlanta with only 40 minutes to spare. We told our hostess and waiter and they made sure that our meal was delivered within 10 minutes and we had more than 25 minutes to finish our meal. Definitely a great place for a good sandwich and drinks.

Had a burger that was suppose to be medium, wasn't even close. It was charred and well done. Server was Cory who seemed like a nice guy. was very, very slow. I was waiting for the check, but couldn't get his attention because he was busy doing prep work. Didn't ask how things were until I was almost done. Took forever to get my change back and when he did, it wasn't correct. Highlight was the raspberry tea. I wished I had ordered a raspberry tea and ate somewhere else!
So friendly! Great airport snacks! Yelp won't post this as a review unless I BS and make it longer, so now it's longer. A little longer perhaps? Yes. That should be good.
Stopped by the airport for a connection and had some lunch. Staff was great and had a nice meal for a change.
I place my order and after about 15 minutes the server comes out and tells me they don't have mashed potatoes? Have to settle for a turkey burger totally disappointed!

If you are at or around Gate T4 at Hartsfield-Jackson, TGIF is right there where you can watch if your plane is boarding.  Since my flight was delayed, I stopped in and at lunch.  Good service, decent food and okay prices for an airport.
Good for a quick bite before a flight.  Better than most TGIFs I have visited in the metro area.

Arrived at the airport two hours before my coworker so I had time to kill so I ordered lunch at the TGI Friday's inside the airport.  The waitress was friendly and prompt and asked if I was a Flags member which I am so she volunteered to bring out complimentary chips and salsa.  Unexpected and pleasantly surprised!  I ordered a strawberry salad for lunch which was crisp and fresh.  A great visit!

While out of town I visited this location at the airport. The prices are higher in the airport and the food seemed different than a regular location. Being the airport, I understand that the staff can be overwhelmed with orders etc. If the management could explain to the staff that this is how it is in one of the busiest airports in the world. When I see the Friday's name I expect everything to be exact across the board when it come to service, prices and  experience.

Stopped in for a burger and beer. Ordered the sedona burger. It was awful. The meat was thin and waaay over cooked. More like a thin piece of leather. The avocado was too thin wafers about the size if a communion wafer. Laughable at best. Pretty much un edible. The seats in this establishment are terrible as well akin to sitting in a five gallon bucket. Waay past time to have redone or thrown out. Only bright spot was the corona beer was good.. I was nervous about the lime by then.

I hate terminal T at Hartsfield. T stand for terrible. That being said, I was slightly hungover and tired so I needed some grease before getting on my flight. (oh and it was morning). This TGI Fridays has a breakfast menu, but they also give you the option to order form the regular menu. I got Steak and eggs. Steak had a weird taste to it, but I just doused it in steak sauce and it was fine. The diet cokes were free flowing and they had real hashbrowns. All-in-all it did the rick on my hangover.  I will say that though the staff was extremely friendly, the service was a bit slow. It took a while for my food to come out so glad I wasn't in a hurry.

I originally came here for the endless apps promotion. Thought it would be cool to sit here for five hours and eat as many boneless buffalo wings as possible. I was told that this location isn't offering the promo. So I went with a boring turkey burger. It was cooked well, came with standard fries. The waitress had a bit of an attitude, felt kind of rushed as well.

My wife and I had a great meal at the T.G.I. Friday's at the E terminal. We split a rack of ribs and substituted the sweet potato fries for the coleslaw and also had regular fries (the sweet potato fries were for the wife). She had a strawberry lemonade which was excellent; I can't recall tasting one any better.  The ribs were easy to cut up with the plastic knife. It took me awhile to figure out why the plastic knife then it hit me that the TSA was afraid restaurant customers would try to shank airline personnel once they're 30,000 miles above ground. So what's the justification for the metal fork? Enough of my rant.  The server cut our ribs in half and served it on two plates with the regular and sweet potato fries evenly split up. The BBQ Sauce was just right. The only problem is that my wife almost eat all of her ribs. I was a little off my game since I was tired from all of the running around on our trip to Atlanta. I finally said to her after she eat about half of her ribs that she hadn't touched her fries. This suggestion worked, because she started to eat her fries and couldn't finish the last rib. So this place will be my go to restaurant at Hartsfield. Terminal E is not crowded like the other terminals, I would say the foot traffic was about 10% of what the other terminals were experiencing. We tried to eat at some other restaurants in other terminals before we just decided to go to our terminal and see what was there. Our service was great and they do turn over the tables very quickly.

I should have just gone to McDonald's. We were seated quickly and had an hour before boarding. I figured that would be plenty of time but we ended up having to press for our check after the food was served because the service was so slow. We were there for breakfast and only when they came to take the order did they notify us that they were out of eggs and only had egg whites. Nearly everything on the breakfast menu depends on eggs. But we had already been here for 15 minutes and felt committed. In retrospect, we should have bailed out here. Roughly 20 minutes later, our food finally arrives. My pancakes were OK but my wife's egg white and toast was cold so it seems like the kitchen doesn't cook orders together. Despite it not being busy, we would only see our waitress once every 15 minutes. By the end, we were rushing to get the credit card back and head for our gate. Seriously, McDonald's was right across the way.

If you are en route and traveling through, this is a good place for a quick, simple, and inexpensive bite to eat. I was in between flights and it was 7am...was feeling quite hungry and craved a mimosa prior to my next flight. My husband and I grabbed a seat in the bar, the server was really friendly, and the service was quick. The breakfast menu is small, but it has the basics on it. Nothing intricate or fancy, but it was good. The only thing I was disappointed about and it wasn't the restaurant fault, but there were ads all over the menu for breakfast mimosas and bloody maries..and since I was craving one, I tried to order, but according to Georgia law, no one can serve alcoholic bevies until 9am. Bummer. Got my hopes up. Oh well...what can you do? The server laughed with us about it how it's a teaser and she apologized, so overall, it was a good airport food experience. If you are hungry and on the go..stop by here in the terminal and grab a bite to eat or a beverage...after 9am, lol.

Who would've thought that TGI Friday's in a FREAKING AIRPORT would be a dining highlight!?  Not me but it was!  First of all, the greeter(s) were seemingly in another world or possibly dimension because there were about 2-5 different people hanging out and finally I got attended to between the other people standing at the door waiting for their to-go orders, gotta love life in airports AMIRIGHT?  Well, my server, was just hands down personable and attentive and not pushy at all. He reeled me in and made it enjoyable.  I had their salmon with a double side of tomato mozz salad.  The salmon was embarrassingly good.  Like, I'm embarrassed that I ATE at Friday's and more ashamed to say I enjoyed it.  But it was good!  The salad on the other hand....they for some reason, drowned it in what appeared to be Italian dressing.  No idea why and kind of ruined the 'clean' aspect of a tomato mozz salad.  All of under $20!

These guys and gals work hard. This is a crazy airport but they get the job done. Food was decent, service was as good as you can expect for a location like this but there are some good things. I didn't have to ask for a refill, the manager walked the floor and asked everyone how was there food  etc. Customer service is on point and they know how to treat a person. Keep hiring the quality people you have and holding them to this expectation. Great job!
slow service!!. It's an airport for crying out loud! Smells like sweaty gym socks in here.
Horrible service. Waitress had an attitude problem. Will avoid this establishment. Never got our food. If I could give them zero stars I would. PATHETIC!!!!.

I guess it's about typical for what you'd expect at an airport.  The food didn't blow me away by any means, but it was food and we were hungry.  I would have to say that the  food quality isn't quite what I'm used to coming from Friday's.  The staff was very polite, and while you should never gamble on time when trying to grab a meal between flights, I would have though what we ordered would have been out a little faster. In all fairness, however, if you have a some time to kill due to a layover or delayed flight, I'm sure this would be a nice place to relax.

Food was average and tasteless. I know there is salt and pepper at the table, but some seasoning would be appreciated. bun on burger was cold, sizzling chicken was not sizzling and cold. There was lettuce swimming in the water.
Easily the worst ribs I have ever eaten in my entire life. Super dry and way over-cooked. Service was good but I can't overlook how bad the ribs were.

Good service at the bar. Can't speak for tables. Food and drinks were top notch and served fast with a smile and attentive, personal service. Got me in and out for my flight without feeling rushed. I'll be back for sure. I've tried all other options in ATL T04 and this is the best.

I haven't been to Friday's in years and I never intended on returning, but when you magically get re-routed through Hartsfield-Jackson late in the evening and everything else has already closed, this is the only option available.  The only redeeming value about this place (and this is definitely specific to this location) is the service. We were promptly seated and even though the kitchen had closed about 20 minutes prior, they still served us. Our waitress was incredibly friendly, fast and accurate. The food, however, really leaves something to be desired. I ordered the gardenburger, which should be something that's not too difficult to screw up, right?! It's T.G.I. Friday's, for shit's sake. They just need to open some overly packaged container, stick it in a microwave, and serve it to me in a timely manner for the low price of $14. How difficult is that? Welp, apparently it's pretty difficult. The patty itself seemed really overcooked; it was dry, tasteless, and somewhat freezer burnt (I don't think a lot of people in Atlanta order gardenburgers). The bun for the burger was really dry as well, and extremely cold in the middle. Maybe the microwave was broken. Unless it's really "late" at night, skip Friday's and choose from one of the many other lovely chain options that Hartsfield-Jackson has to offer.
Only sat at the bar and had a couple drinks but VERY friendly and upbeat bartenders - particularly for early morning. Would definitely come back next time I'm in this concourse!

I ordered a cheeseburger and fries. Super good and fresh. The server, Asia, was super nice. The whole staff was kind and friendly. Definately recommend stopping by when you are passing through in the future.

I know airport restaurants are trying to be fast to get people in and out, but my dragon fire chicken dinner was under "nuked", the rice was a nasty clump and the chicken looked dry and not very appealing. Sent it back, no apology or anything from the waitress. Ordered a salad to be safe.

Great service at the bar Peggy was great. On the ball with asking if I needed anything. The food was fresh I ordered the California Club and it was amazing. I heard Peggy tell people who were coming in to order that the food would take atleast 20 mins. I am not sure if they all tell this but she made sure to warn people so they would not miss their flights.
As airport bars go, this place is great. The bartenders are friendly and competent. Skip the Sam Adams bar in the same terminal, and go here instead. (This is for terminal T)

It's an airport restaurant with jacked up food and drink prices. But what place isn't.  The food, wasn't the standard quality of Friday's but it was decent enough. More importantly, they had a good selection of beer on tap. It was my last chance to get Yuengling before I headed back west. Friday's was happy to oblige.  I was traveling with an ear infection and I wanted to be good and drunk on the plane in case my ear drum blew, I wanted the pain to be a bit numb. I was two beers shy of drinking a GALLON of beer. I missed the mark because my flight came due and not because they wanted to cut me off. They actually offered to get me within one but I didn't have the time to finish it off. The place was busy and popping but the service remained solid while I was there.  In general when I'm at Fridays, you have to get the pot stickers. They have the second best pot stickers on the planet. The best pot stickers on the planet (excluding Japan, because I haven't been there yet) are in J-Town in Paris.  Get the pot stickers, and the fried green beans. I'm also a fan of anything with the Jack Daniels grilling sauce. I find that to be a great sweet sauce that makes everything it touches taste better.

I love TGI Fridays, but this location needs to be visited by corporate.  First there were three hosts blocking the entrance and customers leaving had to push their way past them as they wouldn't move.  They just stood around talking and pretty much ignored customers.  The food was good as always.  The wait staff found it only necessary to take your order and then ignore you the rest of the time.  It took 15 minutes to track down our waitress for a refill on our iced tea.  Then another 10 minutes to get our check.  And we weren't the only ones ignored.   Other customers had to get out of their seats and talk to the hosts to get their waitress to come to their table.  If it were me I would send in an executive to see all the things they are doing wrong.
Great all american burger, bberry long island, whiskey chocolate cake while we waited for our flight. Ebony J is an awesome and friendly server. Will be back on our return layover.

Tamara what a greater she was! Landed in ATL from LA, went to TGIF to grab a quick drink while our flight was long and uncomfortable...she changed everything. Her laugh contagious and sweet. Joyful! Great customer service! Thank you for being so friendly!

For a chain Restaurant in a very busy airport terminal I was impressed with the upbeat polite attitude of the staff they were getting crushed and still kept a wonderful attitude they did not try to rush you they took their time and got the entire order right even with my pain in the ass low carb requests the food is what it is at a chain but it was done correctly and was served hot all I ask for at a chain if you are in Terminal T and have time for a sit down meal it's worth the long walk down to their end of the terminal

I've been to a lot of TGI Fridays over the years and, with the exception of the one where I'm friends with the bartender, this location has the best service. We were seated immediately. The waitress was very fast and friendly and made a great desert recommendation. The food was classic Friday's, as always. Definitely a recommend if you're in the Atlanta airport!
We ate breakfast here during a layover. Food isn't that bad. They serve egg whites. Service was good and attentive. Which was great to have after a red eye flights
AVOID!! Slow, rude service! Salad of onions and lettuce ribs, no tortilla chips, avocado, or dressing.  Walk a little further and get something edible!

TGIF is a decent choice for a restaurant chain. At this airport location it can get quite busy. Our recent visit was just OK. Service was slow (but we had time) and the steak my wife ordered 'rare' came to us 'raw'. They did provide a suitable replacement.

Just how do you save a starved couple that has less than 30 minutes to board a flight?  Why, by standing outside of your restaurant and yelling (while smiling at the same time) for them to come on in and get a hot meal.  She was cute, bubbly and promised to have our food on the table in 15 minutes.  Fried green beans were nice & crispy, and I couldn't really "taste" anything else for shoving it down my throat.  The drinks were on par, and the food was piping hot!  Customer service was superb, and   the jog to the concourse was that much more fun...  Thanks Friday's!
Bad and slow service. Mixed up my card with someone else's bill! Never got my food on time and still had to pay for it.

Four stars for an airport establishment, three stars for the restaurant itself. We were promptly seated and served at this busy ATL eatery. The restaurant has lots of food court options, but it was nice to sit down and be served. Very friendly service who checked back often - not always the norm at the airport. Food was as to be expected for a TGI Fridays, although fresher than I usually find at the airport. Some TGi's in airports have an extremely limited menu, however this one had most of the menu available.  No power outlets around most seating areas if that's what you need...

I only went here because the Sojourner bar down the concourse was serving beer in plastic cups. Sat down in the bar area, there were 3 guys that looked like employees milling around, I guess they are bartender/servers, one finally came over and had not so much as a smile, a welcome, a what can I get you, just a frown. Thats all we got from all three. Hey, I have bad days too, but really! I hate to be mean but there was also a female server in the area, who did not serve us but passed our table very often, who was wider than the aisles. What that meant was every couple of minutes we got slammed by her big hips.  All in all unpleasant.

Free WIFI! Are you kidding me. This is an oasis in ATL, (the only airport on earth not offering free wifi.... cheapskates)..... But not to worry TGI FRIDAY'S is here!!!!! For a review on the actual restraunt, truth is I hate this place. Really small, the bartenders aren't like at DCA (where they can make you any drink on the fly, even something you made up yourself). It makes me feel like I am being held prisoner with a bunch of other stressed out travelers. But now that I know they have wifi, I will be hanging out somewhere close by. Thanks for the public service TGIF, I will continue to frequent all of your other locations!

Definitely the best airport meal I have had . Service was good - our guy Melvin may have forgotten to put in my drink when I ordered it because it took some time - but the Berri sour was fantastic . Food was prompt for the most part , and tasted good . No issues with this little stop on our way home .
